'''Adrian Johnston''' (born 1961) is a British musician and composer for film and TV who resides in [[London]] and [[Samois-sur-Seine]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=Vanoli-Salmon|first1=Robyn|last2=Bromley|first2=Jessica|title=RTS Announces Winners of Craft & Design Awards 2010/2011|url=https://www.rts.org.uk/rts-announces-winners-craft-design-awards-20102011|website=Royal Television Society (RTS)|accessdate=19 March 2015}}</ref> Born in [[Cumbria]], [[England]], Johnston attended [[Edinburgh University]], reading English. He has been a drummer in bands including Moles for Breakfast, [[The Waterboys]], the Wanglers, Combo Zombo, and [[The Mike Flowers Pops]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Composer Details: Adrian Johnston|url=http://www.soundtrackcollector.com/catalog/composerdetail.php?composerid=2496|work=Soundtrack Collector|publisher=C&C Concept and Creation|accessdate=5 May 2013}}</ref> During his twenties, he travelled the world providing music accompaniment to silent films at film festivals. He later scored productions for the [[Royal National Theatre]] and the [[Royal Shakespeare Company]].

Johnston's first film score was for the 1996 Thomas Hardy adaptation ''[[Jude (film)|Jude]]''. He has also composed original scores for ''[[Becoming Jane]]'', a 2007 film about [[Jane Austen]],<ref>{{cite news|last=Newton|first=Robert|title=Noteworthy CD releases|url=http://www.csmonitor.com/2007/0803/p13s01-almp.html|accessdate=5 May 2013|newspaper=The Christian Science Monitor|date=3 August 2007}}</ref> and the 2008 adaptation of [[Evelyn Waugh]]'s ''[[Brideshead Revisited (film)|Brideshead Revisited]]''. In 2008, he was awarded a [[BAFTA]] for the score of the BBC film ''[[Capturing Mary]]''.<ref>{{cite web|title=Television Craft Awards Winners in 2008|url=http://www.bafta.org/television/craft-awards/winners-2008,2434,BA.html|publisher=BAFTA|accessdate=5 May 2013|date=11 May 2008}}</ref>

Johnston's score for [[Charles Sturridge]]'s mini-series ''[[Shackleton (TV serial)|Shackleton]]'' won a 2002 [[Primetime Emmy]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Shackleton|url=http://www.emmys.com/shows/shackleton|work=Emmys|publisher=Academy of Television Arts and Sciences|accessdate=5 May 2013}}</ref> In 2009, he scored the British science-fiction procedural TV series ''[[Paradox (TV series)|Paradox]]''. He composed the theme music for the BBC detective series ''[[Zen (TV series)|Zen]]'', which won him a 2011 [[RTS Awards]];<ref>{{cite web|first1=Robyn|last1=Vanoli-Salmon|first2=Jessica|last2=Bromley|title=RTS Announces Winners of Craft & Design Awards 2010/2011|url=https://www.rts.org.uk/rts-announces-winners-craft-design-awards-20102011|website=Royal Television Society (RTS)|date=2010|accessdate=19 March 2015}}</ref> the World War II drama ''[[The Sinking of the Laconia]]''; Stephen Poliakoff's acclaimed 2013 TV series ''Dancing on the Edge''; and the drama ''[[The 7.39]]''. Johnston won another RTS award in 2014 for scoring ''[[The Tunnel (TV series)|The Tunnel]]''.<ref>{{cite web|title=RTS announces winners of the Craft & Design Awards 2013/14|url=https://www.rts.org.uk/rts-announces-winners-craft-design-awards-2013-14|website=Royal Television Society (RTS)|accessdate=19 March 2015|date=2 December 2014}}</ref>
